page.title: 17THE KESTEVEN MORRIS DANCERS
page.content: { THE KESTEVEN MORRIS TEAM}TRIES TO KEEP THE TRADITION OF MORRIS DANCE ALIVE.THERE ARE ABOUT 12 MEN AND 12 WOMEN IN THE GROUP,PERFORMING SEPARATELY.THE CLUB FIRST DANCED IN THE TOWNS JUBILEE CELEBRATIONS IN THE SUMMER OF 1977.THE TEAM HAS REPRESENTED GRANTHAM IN GERMANY. THE DANCES MOSTLY COME FROM COTSWOLDS AREA OF ENGLAND AND ADAPTED TO SUIT THE LIVELY AND INDIVIDUAL STYLE OF THE GROUP TO ENTERTAIN AND INFORM THE PUBLIC. MEN DANCERS WEAR WHITE SHIRTS,BLACK BREECHES,WHITE SOCKS,GREEN AND RED BALDRIES,BLACK SHOES.BALDRIC DESIGN INCORPORATES TOWN CREST AND A WHEAT SHEAF.THE WOMEN WEAR LONG RED DRESSES AND BLACK,SHORT SLEEVED SHIRTS,BLACK {STOCKINGS AND RED SHOES.ALL WEAR BELLS {TULL CLANCEY (14)}
